meanings.definition: One who sets or determines the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The pricer at the store decided how much the new product would cost.
meanings.sent2: The pricer in the market adjusted the rates based on demand.
meanings.sent3: The pricer accidentally priced a toy at $1000, causing a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent4: She was a pricer of rare antiques, valuing each piece with precision.
meanings.sent5: The pricer's job requires a keen eye for market trends and consumer behavior.

meanings.definition: A tool or software used to calculate or determine prices.
meanings.sent1: The pricer on the website helped customers compare different products easily.
meanings.sent2: The new pricer software streamlined the pricing process for the company.
meanings.sent3: The pricer tool made it simple for the small business owner to set competitive prices.
meanings.sent4: Using the pricer app, she quickly found the best deals on electronics.
meanings.sent5: The pricer program saved time by automatically updating prices based on market changes.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that prices items for sale.
meanings.sent1: The pricer at the garage sale labeled each item with care.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop hired a pricer to assess the value of the old paintings.
meanings.sent3: The pricer cat in the storybook had a magical ability to assign worth to objects.
meanings.sent4: The pricer machine efficiently tagged each item with a barcode.
meanings.sent5: The pricer's job involves researching market trends to determine fair prices for products.
